task_summary: Perceive the maroon object, approach and align to it, execute a straight push over a short distance, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm operates above a tabletop with several objects: a tall maroon block near the left, an orange stack, small cans (blue, silver, red), and a green bottle to the right. The goal is to push the maroon object along the table surface. The behavior tree first ensures the object is perceived (or scans if not), then aligns the end-effector, performs a straight push with moderate travel, and finally retreats to avoid interference with nearby items.
preconditions: Maroon object rests on table within reachable workspace
stepwise_plan: If the maroon object is not visible, scan to acquire it.
Approach and align the TCP to the object with tight tolerance.
Push the maroon object a short distance along the table.
success_criteria: Maroon object translates on the table approximately the commanded distance
No grasping; object remains on surface
Robot ends in a non-contact, safe pose
failure_and_recovery: If object not visible: perform scan routine
If alignment fails: re-run approach after scan on next tick
If push stalls due to friction: shorter reattempt after retreat could be triggered in a higher-level loop
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after retreat completes following a successful push or after tree failure if perception or approach cannot succeed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the maroon object is currently visible.
Active scan to acquire the target if not visible.
Approach and align the TCP to the object's pushing contact pose.
Execute a straight push of the maroon object along the table.
Back off to a safe standoff after pushing.

failure_modes: Object not visible due to occlusion
Misalignment causing side slip during push
Insufficient friction leading to TCP slide without object motion
Collision with nearby items during approach or push
recovery_strategy: Fallback to scanning when visibility fails
Re-approach after new perception if alignment is poor
Short retreat then re-push with same parameters under supervisor control
assumptions: The 'maroon object' refers to the tall red/maroon block on the left; frames are slightly ambiguous with a red can present too.
Push direction assumed along table x-axis (direction_deg=0) away from the robot; exact world axis not labeled in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Visible translation of maroon object by ~0.20 m without lifting
No toppling of objects or collisions
